title: US-China Trade Spat / US Federal Reserve Policy Uncertainty / US-China Trade War / Global Gold Prices / South China Sea Dispute / Iran Nuclear Program / Syrian Civil War / Hong Kong Protests / India-Pakistan Tensions / Taiwan Strait Tensions / US-China Tech Cold War / India-China Border Standoff / South China Sea Dispute / Taiwan Strait Military Tension / US-China Diplomatic Tensions / Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) Expansion / US-Russia Diplomatic Crisis / India-China Border Tensions / Iran Nuclear Program / Russia-Ukraine Tension / US-China Tech Cold War / Iran Nuclear Program / Hong Kong Autonomy / Russian-Ukrainian Conflict / China-Taiwan Tensions / Middle East Conflicts / Indo-Pacific Power Struggle
description: Observers warn of lingering uncertainty in US-China trade relations despite de-escalation attempts. Concerns over the Fed's policy trajectory and the broader impact of Washington's protectionist trade stance dampen market sentiment. Trump announces 35% tariff rate for goods imported from Canada, escalating global trade tensions; India negotiating with US for trade deal. Gold prices climb due to renewed tariff threats and uncertainty from Trump's policies; US dollar strength caps gains. China asserts 'historic rights' in South China Sea, challenging US Navy freedom of navigation operations. Iran announces it will no longer abide by any operational limits of its nuclear deal, escalating tensions with the US and Europe. Turkey intensifies its military operations in northeast Syria, targeting Kurdish forces and risking direct confrontation with US troops. Pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong turn violent as police fire tear gas and water cannons at demonstrators, marking the anniversary of the city's handover to China. India accuses Pakistan of sponsoring terrorism, further straining relations between the two nuclear-armed neighbors. Taiwan reports increased Chinese military activity near the island, fueling concerns over potential conflict and Taiwan's sovereignty. The US imposes export controls on semiconductors to Huawei, intensifying tech and cybersecurity tensions between the US and China. Indian and Chinese troops remain in a standoff along the disputed Himalayan border, raising geopolitical and military tensions. China's coast guard clashes with Vietnamese fishing boats near the Spratly Islands, escalating regional tensions in the South China Sea. China conducts military exercises near Taiwan Strait, increasing regional military and geopolitical tensions. US and Chinese diplomats held contentious meetings in Alaska, marking a new low in US-China relations. TSMC, the world\u2019s largest contract chipmaker, announced a $100 billion investment over the next three years to increase production capacity, addressing the global chip shortage. The US ordered the Russian Embassy in Washington DC to reduce staff by May 4, 2022, escalating tensions between the two nations. India and China held military talks to de-escalate border tensions, following clashes in the disputed Ladakh region. Iran announced it had started producing uranium metal, a key component for nuclear weapons, further straining relations with the international community. Russia amasses troops near Ukraine border, escalating geopolitical tensions. US House passes CHIPS Act, escalating tech tensions with China. Iran ramps up uranium enrichment, raising concerns over nuclear proliferation. China imposes new security law, further eroding Hong Kong's autonomy. Tensions between Russia and Ukraine remain high, with ongoing military activity and geopolitical maneuvering in the region. Cross-strait tensions between China and Taiwan have escalated, with military drills and geopolitical posturing from both sides. Conflicts in the Middle East, including the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and the Syrian civil war, remain active, causing regional instability and humanitarian crises. The Indo-Pacific region experiences ongoing power struggles, with China, the US, and regional actors vying for influence and control.

title: Middle East Geopolitical Tension / Iran-Israel Conflict / Balochistan Fisheries Crisis / Israel-Palestine Religious Conflict / Palestinian-Israeli Conflict / Israel-Palestine Conflict
description: Reported 60-day ceasefire offer in Gaza Strip and potential prisoner exchange deal with Hamas reduces geopolitical risk premiums. Israeli airstrikes on Iranian cities prompt international diplomacy aimed at de-escalating the conflict. Pakistan-Iran border closure disrupts fuel inflow and fish export, crippling fishing communities in Balochistan. Ongoing religious tensions between Israelis and Palestinians escalate, resulting in violence and unrest in Jerusalem. Palestinian militants fired rockets into Israel, and Israeli forces responded with airstrikes, escalating the longstanding conflict. Escalating violence in Jerusalem; Israeli forces and Palestinian militants clash.

title: Australian Murder Trial
description: Erin Patterson stands trial for allegedly poisoning family members with death cap mushrooms; defense claims it was a tragic accident.

title: Italo Bocchino vs Antonio Padellaro
description: Tense exchange between Italian politician Italo Bocchino and journalist Antonio Padellaro during a book presentation at 'Il libro possibile' festival.

title: Germany's F-35 Fighter Jet Purchase / Franco-German FCAS Fighter Partnership / French National Day Parade 2025 / European Tornado Fighter Replacement
description: Germany does not plan to buy additional F-35 fighter jets beyond the 35 already agreed upon, contradicting a recent report. France's demand for 80% participation in the FCAS project may disrupt the agreed division of tasks and delay project progress. The 2025 French National Day Parade will focus on double centenary m\u00e9moriel, strategic solidarity with partners, and youth engagement. Germany has ordered 35 F-35 fighter jets to replace 85 Tornado fighters, with no plans to purchase additional F-35s at this time.

title: Russia-Ukraine Conflict / Ukraine-Russia Border Tension
description: Russian troops continue to amass near Ukraine border, raising concerns of an imminent invasion and further destabilizing the region. Russia fortifies its border with Ukraine, deploying troops and military equipment, amidst escalating geopolitical tension.

title: Venezuelan Political Crisis / Colombia-Venezuela Border Crisis / Colombia-Venezuela Border Crisis / Colombia Drug War
description: Juan Guaid\u00f3 calls for fresh protests against President Maduro, as the political and humanitarian crisis in Venezuela deepens. Colombia accuses Venezuela of pushing thousands of migrants back across the border, exacerbating tensions between the two countries. Colombia accused Venezuela of expelling thousands of Colombians, further straining diplomatic relations between the two countries. Colombian military intensifies operations against drug cartels, sparking violence.

title: Brexit Negotiations
description: UK and EU fail to reach agreement on post-Brexit trade relations, increasing the likelihood of a no-deal Brexit and its potential economic consequences.

title: Myanmar Rohingya Crisis / Myanmar Political Instability / Myanmar Military Coup Aftermath / Myanmar Political Unrest / Myanmar Political Crisis
description: UN Human Rights Council approves resolution to investigate alleged genocide against Rohingya Muslims by Myanmar's military, intensifying international pressure on the government. Myanmar's military coup and ensuing political unrest trigger international sanctions and regional instability. Myanmar's military junta continues to crack down on pro-democracy protesters, causing international outrage. Myanmar\u2019s military junta extended the state of emergency until August 2023, maintaining political instability in the region. Myanmar's military junta continues crackdown on pro-democracy protesters.

title: Ethiopia-Tigray Conflict / Ethiopia Conflict / Ethiopia-Tigray Conflict
description: Ethiopia's military clashes with Tigray rebels, causing a humanitarian crisis and regional instability. The Ethiopian government declared a state of emergency as fighting between the government and Tigray rebels intensified, threatening regional stability. Ethiopian forces and Tigray rebels clash, risking regional stability.

title: Brazil-Amazon Environmental Crisis
description: Deforestation in the Amazon rainforest reaches record levels, sparking environmental concerns and international pressure on Brazil.

title: North Korean Missile Tests
description: North Korea conducted multiple missile tests, defying international sanctions and raising tensions in the region.

title: Climate Change and Drought in Madagascar
description: Madagascar is facing its worst drought in 40 years, affecting over 1.14 million people and exacerbating food insecurity due to climate change.

title: Taliban Advance in Afghanistan
description: Taliban gains control of more districts, threatening security and stability.

title: Barry Callebaut Financial Struggle / Cocoa Price Volatility / Barry Callebaut Cost Pass-Through Delay / Barry Callebaut Working Capital and Liquidity Crunch / Barry Callebaut Credit Rating Warnings / BC Next Level Delays
description: Barry Callebaut, a Zurich-based chocolate giant, reported a steep drop in Q3 FY25 results, with global chocolate volumes decreasing by -5.1% and cocoa volumes by -11.3%. Revenue growth was +56.7% in local currencies and +49.5% in CHF for the first nine months. Cocoa prices have swung wildly, up 43% year-on-year before a sudden correction, causing challenges for Barry Callebaut's cost-plus pricing model, which has proven slower than expected in adapting to these sharp changes. Barry Callebaut has recovered roughly 50% of cost increases in H1, but long-term B2B contracts and the gourmet division are slow to adjust. Feld's team is negotiating with clients to shorten payment cycles and move toward more dynamic pricing models. Barry Callebaut's balance sheet shows mounting pressure, with inventory levels surging, net working capital nearly doubling, operating cash flow sinking to negative CHF 2 billion, and net debt climbing to CHF 6.1 billion. Agencies like Moody's and S&P have sounded the alarm due to persistent cash flow and leverage concerns. Net debt/EBITDA stands at an alarming 8x, far from the group\u2019s historical average of 3-4x. Barry Callebaut's flagship transformation initiative, BC Next Level, is now 12 months behind schedule, aiming for CHF 250 million in annual savings, with 75% expected to impact EBITDA.
